meanings.definition: An object made by a human being, typically of cultural or historical interest.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed ancient artifacts from Egypt.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists unearthed many artifacts from the ancient city.
meanings.sent3: The time traveler accidentally left futuristic artifacts in the past.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an artifact of her joyful personality.
meanings.sent5: The artifacts in the exhibit told a fascinating story of the past.

meanings.definition: A structure or feature not normally present but visible as a result of an external agent or action.
meanings.sent1: The rainbow was a beautiful artifact of the sunlight and rain.
meanings.sent2: The mirage in the desert was a natural artifact of the heat.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act was an amusing artifact of his talent.
meanings.sent4: The footprints in the snow were artifacts of the hiker's journey.
meanings.sent5: The echo in the canyon was a striking artifact of the sound bouncing off the walls.
